ygData.subject: Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for your reply Tom. I tried running a broadscope crawl using the current 1.3 snapshot of the CVS head. I also used BdBFrontier with 50 threads and

From: "Saurabh Pathak" <sau_pathak@...>
Subject: Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=126110077
X-Yahoo-Profile: sau_pathak


Thanks for your reply Tom. 

I tried running a broadscope crawl using the current 1.3 snapshot of
the CVS head. I also used BdBFrontier with 50 threads and allocated
1280M heap. This time again after downloading 250,000 or so documents
crawl came to a sudden halt as it ran out of memory and I received a
SEVERE alert as well. 

Also can somebody tell me what this line signifies in
progress-statistics.log file,

20050415033505 CRAWL WAITING TO PAUSE

After the above line the busy thread count plummeted from 49 to 2.

Below I am pasting thread dump and relevant output from
heritrix_out.log file (please excuse for unformatted data),

<<<

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Tom Emerson <Tree@b...> wrote:
> Broad=scope memory issues is a known problem. First off, see
> 
> http://crawler.archive.org/faq.html#oome_broadcrawl
> 
> Secondly, I'd grab a 1.3 snapshot and try using that with the
> BdbFrontier --- it helps a lot.
> 
> Finally, not that it is relevant for your specific case, I've been
> running a crawl for the last 7 days over 60 seeds using a set of
> custom SURT prefixes (including some rather open-ended ones, like
> "http://(cn,org,").
> 
> So far I've crawled 4,091,915 documents out of 10,610,687 discovered
> (so far) for 62 GB of data (I'm just saving HTML), running 75
> toe-threads with a 512MB heap. This is with a (now 7 day old) snapshot
> of CVS head. Heritrix is chugging along just fine at around 9.2 docs
> per second, 158 KB/sec, on an old 666 MHz i686.
> 
> 
> -- 
> Tom Emerson                                          Basis
Technology Corp.
> Software Architect                                
http://www.basistech.com
>   "Beware the lollipop of mediocrity: lick it once and you suck forever"
